item.title: Linux mandriva (need help not solved)
item.dc:creator: @pkerzscap3 pkerzscap3
item.description:
@pkerzscap3 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]To run a script as any other unix/linux command, make sure the first line in the script is calling a shell in which the script will run. Like “#!/bin/bash” etc.

Give permissions to owner, group and others who will have right to run the script.

chmod o+x example.sh (refer to chmod and chown commands man page)

from your login prompt sun the command

$ ./example.sh (or give path name of the file)

If you want to run the command (script) without specifying the path, add location of the script to PATH environment variable.[/quote]
